column4: when i run sudo gedit xorg.conf , i get gedit but its blank. i know the file exists as everyone has it, and without it i wouldnt see any windows. what am i doing wrong?
you have to be in the right directory or use the absolute path.  and you should use gksudo with gui apps:  gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
thanks , stupid mistake on my part.
